definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: And we sailed thence, and came the next day over against Chios;
sentences.chinese: 從那裏開船，次日到了基阿的對面。

sentences.english: 15The next day we set sail from there and arrived off Kios.
sentences.chinese: 從那裏開船，次日到了基阿的對面。

sentences.english: He laid himself down under the thwarts and waited, panting.
sentences.chinese: 躺在坐板下面，氣喘吁吁地等着開船。

sentences.english: Does he need my help navigating?
Embarkment written two weeks before the scheduled warehouse procedures Ibid .
sentences.chinese: 開船前兩週書面定倉，程序同上。

sentences.english: There are more sailings from Huangpu instead of Shantou?
sentences.chinese: 黃蒲開船的班次比汕頭多。

sentences.english: 15The next day we set sail from there and arrived off Kios.
sentences.chinese: 從那裏開船，次日到了基阿的對面。

sentences.english: Lalor, steamed away from shore leaving sampans full of Chinese soldiers behind.
sentences.chinese: Lalor下令開船拋下滿載中國士兵的小船。

sentences.english: I can sail a ship without wind.
I used to drive ship in my hometown. Trust me!
sentences.chinese: 小意思，你別小看我，我在老家就常開船。

sentences.english: If there should be any last-minute change in the sailing time, we'll contact you by telephone.
sentences.chinese: 開船時間假如臨時有更改，我們會用電話通知你。

sentences.english: The company advertised the sailing day .
sentences.chinese: 這家公司公佈了開船日期。

sentences.english: As the boat started to move, my friend Hong called me outside the cabin.
sentences.chinese: 開船的時候，朋友洪在艙外喚我。

sentences.english: When the boat was about to leave, my friend Hong called me outside the cabin.
sentences.chinese: 開船的時候，朋友洪在艙外喚我。

definition: to start/to set in motion/to move/to march/to dig in (eating)/to tuck in (eating)
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
to assign sb to a seat/to be allocated a place
not on time/late (public transport, airlines)/overdue/behind schedule/delayed
lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
number plate/car license plate/CL:條|条[tiao2],塊|块[kuai4],片[pian4]
Cebu, a province (and a city) in the Philippines (Tw)
shuttle bus ferrying passengers between train stations on two different rail lines
jointing machine/riveter/welder/sealer/to meet a plane (i.e. to meet sb at airport)/to service a plane (of airport workers)
to reserve a seat/to book a table/reservation
lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information
to go on a journey/to leave
